definition: to turn a blind eye to
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
to seem/like/as/if
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
old variant of 睹[du3]
to observe/to see

sentences.english: If you were still together , you're telling me you could just walk away from her?
sentences.chinese: 那若你们还在一起，你能对她视若无睹吗？

sentences.english: Whoever closes their eyes to the past, will be blind to the present.
sentences.chinese: 对过去视若无睹的人也将瞽盲于现在。

sentences.english: Zhiqiu sometimes just stay middle aisle, the students will turn a blind eye.
sentences.chinese: 有时纸团刚好呆在过道中间，同学们就会视若无睹。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
indifferent/apathetic/cold
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to glare at
to glower at each other (idiom)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to remain unmoved
